e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize accuracy, transparency, and fairness, providing truthful and unbiased financial information. It should protect all investors, ensuring no group is disadvantaged due to omitted or misleading details. Legal compliance, stakeholder communication, and long-term trust-building are crucial, alongside considering the impact on various investor types.
e6: How does management plan to communicate the policy change to investors effectively, especially retail investors, to prevent misinterpretations?
